content.description: A system where the future states are completely determined by the current state and inputs. No randomness or unpredictability. Same inputs always produce same outputs.
content.title: Deterministic System

content.description: A measure of disorder or randomness in a system. In information theory, entropy measures uncertainty or information content. Higher entropy means more disorder or uncertainty.
content.title: Entropy

content.description: Every effect has a cause. Events do not occur randomly without underlying causes. This principle underpins scientific reasoning and deterministic systems.
content.title: Principle of Causality

content.description: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another. The total energy of an isolated system remains constant.
content.title: Law of Conservation of Energy
